entry.title: Interesting Thingys 52
entry.content:
Quite a variety of categories this week…

JavaScript

  • jQuery 2.0 Released | Official jQuery Blog The big 2.0 release
  • BinaryJS - Realtime binary streaming for the web using websockets Realtime binary streaming for the web using websockets
  • Welcome - Sub Protocol An open source physics engine made for constructing 2D dynamic body simulations.
  • tmcw/englewood.js · GitHub dot-density maps in javascript
  • AngularJS: 6 Common Pitfalls Using Scopes – TNG - The Nitty Gritty A very interesting read, if you develop SPAs with Angulat.js
  • Building Huuuuuge Apps with AngularJS A very helpful read, if you plan to build bigger Apps with Angular.js
  • Animation in AngularJS If you miss Animations in Angular.js, you should read this!

CSS

  • Responsive drop shadows | 456 Berea Street Examples of responsive drop shadows
  • CSS Overflow Module Level 3 First Public Working Draft

Web Development

  • Never Say WordPress When Selling a Web Design Project How to not debate over technology with your clients
  • codrops/FullscreenLayoutPageTransitions · GitHub This responsive layout is based on an initial grid of four boxes. Once a box is clicked, it gets resized to fullscreen and the other boxes scale down and fade out. In the work section we experiment with another transition which is to show a panel by making it appear from the bottom while scaling the current one down. To see it in action, open the work section and click on one of the portfolio items and navigate through them.

Mobile Webdevelopment

  • Why LinkedIn dumped HTML5 Interesting LinkedIn changed their apps to native. Small part performance, bigger memory issues and the big problem tooling support

Ruby

  • chrismccord/sync · GitHub Real-time Rails Partials

Node.js

  • Announcing OpsMezzo — blog.nodejitsu.com After more than 18 months of work, Nodejitsu announced the release of OpsMezzo at TXJS this week, a complete solution to provisioning, orchestration and configuration management.
  • Using JSON in Postgres and Node.js Postgres supports JSON natively and can be a good persistence layer for Node.js

Objective C

  • mneorr/Alcatraz · GitHub The most awesome (and only) Xcode package manager!
  • tumblr/TMCache · GitHub Fast parallel object cache for iOS and OS X.

Browsers

  • WWW-Talk Apr-Jun 1993: NCSA Mosaic 1.0 released Mosaic is 20!!!

Shell

  • Maximizing a Tmux Pane To a New Window | PEMPEK.NET A robust version of maximizing / minimizing a tmux pane. Works perfectly in tmux >= 1.6
  • Vpn Less Persistent SSH Sessions Have you ever got tired of reconnecting all your remote sessions and restoring your workplace?

Programming

  • Signs that you're a bad programmer - Software Engineering Tips very long read
  • Signs that you're a good programmer - Software Engineering Tips the sequel

Databases

  • PGStrom - PostgreSQL wiki Postgres on the GPU

Editors

  • Vim Splits - Move Faster and More Naturally some nice tricks for Vim spilts
  • Vim: Traversing text in Insert mode - Stack Overflow Another answer to a Vim question that starts with 'You are doing it wrong'
  • Supercharged substitution with :Subvert crazy subsitution with a little help from abolish

Watching

  • GeeCON 2012 - Sam Newman - Designing For Rapid Release on Vimeo This talk focuses on the kinds of constraints we should consider when evolving their architecture of our systems in order to enable rapid, frequent release.
  • Impressive Ruby Productivity with Vim and Tmux - Chris Hunt - LA Ruby Conference 2013 Two of my favorite tools united
  • The Death of Ifs no more ifs and case statements

Reading

  • O'Reilly Open Books Project Free O'Reilly books

Miscellaneous

  • Nginx performance tips using ngx_pagespeed | The NetDNA Blog some insights from maxcdn

C

  • SignalR/SignalR · GitHub Incredibly simple real-time web for .NET

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesting Thingys 51
entry.content:
And another round of awesome Interesting Thingys…

JavaScript

  • Restangular: New Angular framework to handle Rest API Restful Resources properly and easily an alternative to ng resource
  • Snap.js A Library for creating beautiful mobile shelfs in Javascript
  • Log – Console.log with Style Style up your Console.logs
  • Swimlane Chart using d3.js Interactive swimlane built with d3 code

CSS

  • Advanced cross-browser flexbox - Dev.Opera Flexbox is hard to get right across all browsers, because lots of them build on the old API

Web Development

  • LinkedIn for iPad: 5 techniques for smooth infinite scrolling in HTML5 | LinkedIn Engineering How LinkdIn achieves smooth infinite scrolling on the IPad

Ruby

  • GemLou.pe View the full dependency tree for any ruby gem.

Node.js

  • Content Syndication with Node.js - How To Node - NodeJS create a feed with node
  • Sails.js | The future of API development Realtime MVC Framework for Node.js
  • Error handling in node.js - Machado Gustavo's Blog An example of error handling
  • LearnBoost/monk · GitHub The wise MongoDB API, tutles all the way down,... built on mongoskin, that is built on mongo-native

Browsers

  • Developer Tools Update – Firefox 22 ✩ Mozilla Hacks – the Web developer blog a quick look into the new devtools

Shell

  • paulsm/bashtime · GitHub A bash script to display an analog time in your command prompt on OS X

Programming

  • Continuous Delivery from months to weeks | ThoughtWorks Studios See how failing fast and learning fast can help optimize your Continuous Delivery goal from months to weeks
  • Model everything to fail fast | ThoughtWorks Studios How to not fail too late

Databases

  • PostgreSQL 9.3 What's new

Git

  • Starlogs git log meets Star Wars

Watching

  • How Etsy Increased Diversity in Its Engineering Department: An Interview with Marc Hedlund - YouTube Marc Hedlund, Senior Vice President at Etsy, describes the steps he took to bring more women into the company's engineering department.

Miscellaneous

  • Bizarre Soft Robots Evolve to Run - IEEE Spectrum evolution on the run

Fun

  • Fasten Your Seatbelt Before Watching this Google Street View Hyperlapse | Colossal Interesting project.

Raspberry Pi

  • Ambilight-alike Ambilight for your Television, with modified XBMC and Raspberry Pi

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesting Thingys 50
entry.content:
Woohooo, we reached issue no. 50.

JavaScript

  • Adventures in JavaScript Development setinterval is not especially apropriate if you are polling from a server. Read on, to see how to get rid of it
  • sindresorhus/grunt-concurrent · GitHub Run grunt tasks concurrently
  • JSLint Error Explanations - Making Your Feelings Better lookup what an error means
  • Bringing Angular Apps to Life with Animation by Miško Hevery - YouTube On April 3rd, AngularJS 1.1.4 will be released. The primary feature in this release is declarative support for animation in templates.
  • btford/angular-dragon-drop · GitHub "Drag and drop" directives for AngularJS. Work in progress.

CSS

  • CSS Masking - HTML5 Rocks Some nice tricks with CSS masks
  • csscss by zmoazeni csscss will parse any CSS files you give it and let you know which rulesets have duplicated declarations.

HTML5

  • CodePen - A Pen by Mark Kahn nice demo

Web Development

  • jesusabdullah/know-your-http · GitHub A series of A0-sized posters about the HTTP protocol
  • Turn Your Web App into a Windows 8 App - HTML5 Hacks a step by step tutorial

Mobile Development

  • xelvenone/M6ParallaxController · GitHub Parallax controller for a parallaxed view and a table view

Ruby

  • How Shopify Scales Rails - John Duff - Big Ruby 2013 How one of the oldest rails shops survived evolution
  • Ruby 2.0 Works Hard So You Can Be Lazy - Pat Shaughnessy Pat Shaughnessy takes an in-depth look at Ruby 2.0's lazy enumeration feature and how it relates to regular enumerators.
  • IdentityCache: Improving Performance one Cached Model at a Time — Ecommerce Blog by Shopify The caching layer from shopify - a deep dive

Node.js

  • DailyJS: Five Minute Guide to Streams2 A quick walk through of the new streams api
  • Understanding the node.js event loop « Mixu's tech blog A brief and excellent introduction to node.js event loops

Browsers

  • Chrome PLT Improvements - Google Drive How Chrome is improving page load times again
  • What are those transparent bars in Chrome's profiler??? Nat Duca answers this on G
  • Opera confirms it will follow Google and ditch WebKit for Blink, as part of its commitment to Chromium - The Next Web so Google won't be alone working on Blinl
  • IE11: what we know and what we can speculate - Generated Content by David Storey David Storey presents a handy roundup of the latest rumors, news, and experiments with regards to Internet Explorer 11, including its possible WebGL support, new user agent string, and ECMAScript 6 support.

Linux

  • Linux Netcat command - The swiss army knife of networking - MyLinuxBook | MyLinuxBook Everything you wanted to know about netcat

Databases

  • MongoDB Multi-Statement Transactions: Yes We Can | Tokutek Has anyone said that there are no transactions in mongodb?
  • Top 10 Reasons I like Postgres Over SQL Server - DataChomp Theres a variety of reasons we choose the databases we do. Rob Sullivan, a former Microsoft SQL Server DBA, here lays out 10 very clear reasons why he prefers Postgres over SQL Server.

Git

  • Everyday Git Aliases | JoeJag :: Tech Some ideas for git aliases
  • Git Koans / Steve Losh nice

Tools

  • blakeembrey/readable · GitHub Creates a plain text and readable version of any article on the internet by appending the url to the services domain. Has a extremely simple interface to use and plain CSS for some simple styles.

Watching

  • Browserify V2 and You (nix) on Vimeo Presented by James Halliday at JSLA (js.la) March 28th, 2013
  • Setting disruptors to stun keynote at HTML5 Devcon in San Francisco | Christian Heilmann

Fun

  • Absolutely brilliant. via @CristinMcGrath Should you use QR code

UX

  • Transitional Interfaces Some ideas about Animation in the context of Interfaces

Raspberry Pi

  • Raspberry Pi GSM gateway | Raspberry Pi GSM Gateway with two Raspberry Pi

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesting Thingys 49
entry.content:
This week we present you a great variety of interesting thingys…

CSS

  • Crocodoc some nice demos
  • Michiel de Graaf - Generate animations with SASS nice css animations, done with a few lines of sass with @while

HTML5

  • davatron5000/TimeJump · GitHub TimeJump adds deep-linking to HTML5 audio and video podcasts. TimeJump works behind-the-scenes to create a standardized API for seeking, based off the YouTube deep-linking syntax.
  • scottjehl/picturefill · GitHub A Responsive Images approach that you can use today, that mimics the proposed picture element using divs, for safety sake.

Web Development

  • #122: The State of Favicons | CSS-Tricks A short video on the current state

Mobile Development

  • helios-framework/helios · GitHub An extensible open-source mobile backend framework

Ruby

  • Rails' Insecure Defaults - Code Climate Blog 13 defaults you should care about

Browsers

  • Mozilla and Samsung Collaborate on Next Generation Web Browser Engine | The Mozilla Blog could bring Rust to the browser

Shell

  • tmux 1.8 is out with great new features
  • remiprev/teamocil · GitHub There's no I in Teamocil. At least not where you think. Teamocil helps you set up session, window and pane layouts for tmux using YAML configuration files.

Git

  • Navigating through the git history like a boss | Web 0.2 Some tricks for better git history navigation

Editors

  • terryma/vim-expand-region · GitHub vim-expand-region is a Vim plugin that allows you to visually select increasingly larger regions of text using the same key combination. It is similar to features from other editors:

Performance

  • How Fast is Your Web Site? - ACM Queue Web site performance data has never been more readily available.
  • Frameworks Round 2 - TechEmpower Blog Lots of benchmarks and frameworks
  • wg/wrk · GitHub a HTTP benchmarking tool

Watching

  • CODEshow on Vimeo CODEshow is an annual one-day conference focusing on emerging software technology held at the historic Dock Street Theatre in Charleston, South Carolina, recently coined Silicon Harbor. CODEshow.1 featured interactive discussions from domain experts in MongoDB, AngularJS and Node.js

Miscellaneous

  • Design Inspiration: Negative Space Logos and Symbols some nice examples

PHP

  • QafooLabs/php-refactoring-browser · GitHub Automatic Refactorings for PHP Code by generating diffs that describe the refactorings steps.

Fun

  • Google Maps - Treasure Map mode nice

Raspberry Pi

  • Raspberry Pi Terminal with Kindle Paperwhite Turn a Kindle Paperwhite into a wireless Raspberry Pi Terminal
  • Raspbmc: Crack for MPEG2, VC1, DTS hardware decoding! DTS, VC1 and MPEG2 codecs are available for free now. All future installs of Raspbmc will automatically activate all codecs capable in firmware without any additional configuration.

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com

entry.title: Interesting Thingys 48
entry.content:
Lot's of frontend thingys this week with one of my favorite demos the 'tearable cloth'.

JavaScript

  • adamschwartz/chrome-inspector-detector · GitHub A simple utility for detecting whether or not the Chrome Inspector is open or docked.
  • Mouse Path Smoothing for Jack Lumber Twisted Oak Studios | Unity3D Consulting | Technical Magic
  • bramp/js-sequence-diagrams · GitHub Generates UML sequence diagrams from simple text
  • Deploying JavaScript Applications - Alex Sexton Nothing new, but all in one place
  • Tear-able Cloth - CodePen You can even tear it appart
  • akrennmair/speech-to-server · GitHub demo application for libmp3lame.js
  • wagerfield/flat-surface-shader · GitHub Simple, fast, Flat Surface Shader composed of Triangles assembled from Vertices lit by Lights.

CSS

  • Introduction to Custom Filters (aka CSS Shaders) - HTML5Rocks Updates What you can do to your DOM with CSS...
  • Sprite sheet animation with steps(). There is an... | simurai step by step animation with css keyframes
  • websymphony/almost-flat-ui · GitHub Almost Flat UI is licensed under a MIT License. It uses Foundation Framework and is heavily inspired from Flat UI Free by designmodo.
  • Working with flexbox | Adobe Developer Connection Flexible layouts. Equal height columns. Presentation independence from your HTML source order. These things haven't been so easy to achieve with CSS—until now. The flexible box layout, the new flexbox specification, makes creating any of these layouts easy, and much more.
  • Pure CSS Peeling Sticky - CodePen demo
  • Coding4fun: the Star Wars intro in pure CSS3 thanks to 3D transform Star wars intro without a line of JavaScript

Web Development

  • 5 Common Usability Mistakes and Solutions For Avoiding Them David Walsh about five horrible usability mistakes.

Ruby

  • Coding Horror: Why Ruby? Stack Overflow co-founder Jeff Atwood shares his thoughts on why he switched to Ruby and Rails for building his latest 'Discourse' forum software. One of the reasons is that 'Ruby isn't cool any more.'

Node.js

  • juliangruber/level-store · GitHub A streaming storage engine based on LevelDB
  • rvagg/node-levelup · GitHub LevelDB - Node.js style
  • substack: how i write modules how the streams master does his modules
  • maxogden/art-of-node · GitHub a short introduction to node.js

Browsers

  • Internet Explorer 11’s leaked build (new features) what to expect from IE11

Programming

  • substack: many things Substack on small building blocks vs framworks

Databases

  • Robomongo — shell-centric MongoDB management tool Shell-centric MongoDB management tool
  • Scaling PostgreSQL at Braintree: Four Years of Evolution They highlight here their four year journey with Postgres which includes sharding their data and now running an automated failover setup.

Git

  • GitLab 5.0 release, standing on its own two feet - GITLAB Blog great news

Editors

  • tpope/vim-tbone · GitHub Basic tmux support for Vim.

Watching

  • Analyzing Millions of GitHub Commits What Makes Developers Happy, Angry, and Everything in Between?

Listening

  • Hanselminutes Technology Podcast Scott sits down with Chrome Developer Advocate Paul Irish to talk HTML5, JavaScript, Chrome and the Web

Your link could be here

If we missed something special or you just want to promote a site, give us a nudge @ yieldthedog@gmail.com
